page.title: 02Housing in Ringland
page.content: There are about 50 houses in {Ringland.}Some of them are new but many old ones have been knocked down, including a row of cottages and 6 other houses. A number of new ones have been built and 3 barns converted. Some are council houses or tied cottages. The{manor house}in the village has been knocked down. The 300 year old{tithe barn}has been demolished and some of the wood was used for the {village sign,}which shows many of the residents' signatures.{Westgate House has been rebuilt and the reading room turned into the village hall. The village is so isolated that the most widely used{fuel}is bottled gas which is sold by the {sub post {office,}providing them with a major source of income.
